last_post.content:
Super happy with the Moeck alto recorder I bought in Aachen (Germany). Here you can hear it in an anonymous "Cantio Polonica". I based it on the 1619 transcription by Polish Renaissance composer and lutenist Wojciech Albertus Długoraj and transposed it down a fifth.

https://www.youtube.com/shorts/WP4NnbLRDTQ

@Curator #musician #recorderplayer #alto

PEP 703 by Sam Gross and sponsored by @ambv on Making the Global Interpreter Lock Optional in CPython is now a public draft:

https://peps.python.org/pep-0703/

title: La plaga de suplantaciones de instituciones y empresas para sacarte el dinero con llamadas llega a Google

last_post.content:
🇪🇸 Scammers are buying ads on Google posing as legitimate institutions like social security. Victims are instructed to call premium-rate numbers (up to 11€ per minute) that provide no useful information.

Google did not explain why their automated systems do not flag these ads.

https://www.eldiario.es/tecnologia/plaga-suplantaciones-instituciones-empresas-sacarte-dinero-llamadas-llega-google_1_9840751.html

title: Quick tip: you can evaluate pieces of code within your code by using Ctrl + Shift + E

Not new, but fits the #genuary Day 10: "Generative Music" theme..

Inspired by “Awnings, Avenue Matignon”, by Ellsworth Kelly (1950), at 13:20 08/05/2019, I recorded the position of the window blinds at an office block overlooking Tower Bridge, London.

All credit to producer @prestonoutatime who generated the music from the blind data. Each beat, a single column of blinds. The position of each blind changing the structure of the chord played.

My response always is: because no one is listening to new music.

General Electric developed a lifeboat for spacecraft in the early 1960s called MOOSE, which was basically:

-A plastic bag
-A can of foam
-A tiny rocket motor
-A parachute
-A rubber shield

You had to leave your spacecraft in your spacesuit, climb inside the plastic bag, fill it with foam, point yourself at the Earth and fire the motor 😬

The rubber and foam were supposed to stop you burning to death. We will never know if it would have worked.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MOOSE

#Space #SpaceFlight

title: Opinion | I’m a Scientist Who Spoke Up About Climate Change. My Employer Fired Me.

last_post.content:
A climate scientist was just fired for staging a climate protest at a climate change conference. This is outrageous. Scientific institutions need to stop sabotaging themselves. Doing research alone is not enough to save the planet. Scientists must be activists!

#Climate #Activism

Native Americans are asking The Apache Software Foundation, "…to take the necessary steps needed to express the ally-ship they promote so deeply on their website, to act in accordance with their own code of conduct, to “be careful in the words that [they] choose”, and change their name."

It'll be a big change, but IMO one that's necessary and overdue.

title: How the insect got its wings: scientists (at last!) tell the tale

last_post.content: About the possible crustacean leg origin of insect wings https://news.uchicago.edu/story/how-insect-wings-evolved-legs-ancestral-crustacean

Did you know that it is inconclusive what insect wings originally evolved from?
”According to more current literature, possible candidates include gill-like structures, the paranotal lobe, and the crustacean tergal plate. The latter is based on recent insect genetic research which indicates that insects are pan-crustacean arthropods with a direct crustacean ancestor and shared genetic mechanisms of limb development.”

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insect_wing
#evolution #biology

{progressr} 0.13.0 on CRAN.

Setting

options(cli.progress_handlers="progressr")

makes all {cli} progress updates to be handled by {progressr}.

This is a pretty neat {cli} feature, because it allows us to use any combination of {progressr} handlers to report on progress, e.g. beepr (audio), txtprogressbar (terminal), and rstudio (RStudio's progress bar).

https://www.jottr.org/2023/01/10/progressr-0.13.0/

#RStats #progress

The last chart I shared on Django performance was skewed by the rounding of locust to miliseconds. I've written a wrapper for locust so I can get distributions down to the nanosecond so the charts are a little less bias to rounding. https://github.com/tonybaloney/django-compare-tool/blob/master/analysis.ipynb #django

This paper models "discovery" as being interested in finding things with high label values, have a big set of things to label, and can only label a few of the things once each. Similar to scientific discovery. The setting is more general than #bandits, and uses #ExperimentalDesign type ideas. The paper considers the ratio of expected instant regret to information gain as a rule for selecting the next item to label.
https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.14829
#MachineLearning #ml4science

title: NASA unveils initial plan for multibillion-dollar telescope to find life on alien worlds

last_post.content:
Because of the fantastic success of #JWST, now astronomers want even more powerful gear up in space.

They are planning the Habitable Worlds Observatory that would be even bigger and make detecting life on other #Earth-like #planets reality.

The telescope will also be perched at L2. Unlike JWST, it will be designed for robotic servicing and upgrades, which could enable it to operate for decades.

#astronomy #exoplanets #astrobiology
https://www.science.org/content/article/nasa-unveils-initial-plan-multibillion-dollar-telescope-find-life-alien-worlds

'Gender, Care and Livelihoods in Times of Crisis' - this looks like an exciting event on 8 Feb (hybrid - online and in person at UCL).

title: Facebook Wanted Out of Politics. It Was Messier Than Anyone Expected.

last_post.content:
"“It turns out that maybe the way we recommend political content shouldn’t be the same way we recommend entertainment"

Post-Jan 6, FB comes to a conclusion that many others arrived at in the mid-2010s. However, worth reading the article for unintended consequences of downranking political content... ("views of content from what Facebook deems “high quality news publishers” such as Fox News &CNN fell more than material from outlets users considered less trustworthy.")
